abstract: As a big battle over global warming is unfolding in Texas, Fortune takes a look at how green Wall Street’s investment banks really are. At the heart of the controversy is a Dallas-based energy company that wants to build 11 coal-fired plants, which would emit about 78 million tons of carbon dioxide into the air. In an effort to stop the plants, environmentalists, along with a coalition of institutional investors, have turned their attention to Merrill Lynch, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley, the three lead arrangers of TXU‘s financing.
